Message.Title: more pain to come
Message.Msg: In his weekly address, Pres. Obama threatened Americans with more sequester "pain" if they don't convince Congress to pass his budget ..................................................................................................................................................................... yeah, that's all these lib bums can try to do...threaten people with pain. Libs don't realize they are losing the silly argument over sequester cuts. We're onto them.

too bad you bums didn't require Bush to balance the budget instead of letting him raise the debt ceiling countless times and now whining about raising the debt ceiling and demanding sequester and then whining about how cuts to the military and the FAA hurt the nation...... and guess what , the cuts in spending that YOU and the gop will cause pain....... and will cost jobs .... and will slow the economy..... .... you are such weasel hypocrites because after demanding cuts and getting them you then whine about the pain, and the slow economy and the loss of jobs......when you were told to begin with that this would happen and STILL YOU & the gop cheered on the austerity, spending cuts and sequester. ...and note the gop whining here: Senate Republicans News and updates from Republican senators and their staff. "Why is President Obama unnecessarily delaying your flight?" BUT the fact is "the FAA still needs to furlough its 47,000 employees to achieve these congressionally required cuts. Only Congress can stop these delays from continuing.”

Message.Title: gop whines about spending cuts they demanded, remember their debt ceiling tantrum?
Message.Msg: gop hypocrites, liars and whiners seem to think the austerity and spending cuts they demand wont have any pain....jees Rep. Bill Shuster (R-Penn.), chairman of the House Transportation Committee, in a statement listed a number of nonpersonnel costs that he said could be examined first, including ...... but a fact checker agreed that the FAA has no room to do anything but furlough the personnel just like they did and gives the above "three pinocchios" saying it is true that "The FAA has very high fixed costs — both in terms of salaries and contracts — giving it little flexibility. The [gop criticism is ]..... thus is rather misleading about options facing the agency. " Washington post

mesa, ya bum ya. Cuts in the rate of increase (and that is EXACTLY, what's been going on with the sequester) don't hurt...unless one deliberately has that as an objective. Like Obama, like Reid. The dems have taken a hit re the FAA. That's why they crumpled like a cheap suit.

jeez, you don't even understand the sequester, which is what is happening now and which was the result of the weasel gop tantrum over the debt ceiling and which they agreed to ..... to get past the their debt ceiling tantrum which wrecked the nation's credit rating, btw........... so now the sequester , which is due to the gop, is causing pain and the gop lies and whines about it........ as with the FAA, but the fact checkers have verified that the FAA had no choice but to furlough people to meet the demands of the sequester which was born from the gop debt ceiling tantrum.

Message.Msg: As Congress attempts to exempt itself and staff from Obamacare, Henry Waxman said thinks there is confusion about the content of the law. Ya think Henry? Ya think people may be confused over a 2700 page bill that no one read?

it's not causing pain unless one deliberately has that as an objective, which Obama does. A reduction in the rate of increase, Mesa. Only in your world is that a cut. Gov can't do with one dime less, have I got that right Mesa? Of course I do.
And I might remind you that the sequester was Obama's idea. He miscalculated. Inconceivable to him that repubs would go along with it.

Their spending spree required them to give Bush a record number of debt ceiling hikes (only topped by Reagan)......... and now you bums whine about the effects of the sequester which was caused by your debt ceiling tantrum and YOU are the biggest hypocrite of all because YOU cheered on the sequester which requires $85 billion in cuts for 2013........ why didn't the gop just pass a bill to cut the $85 billion from defense? cuts don't have any pain or consequences, right?

you need to be reminded that the sequester was the result of the gop's destructive debt ceiling tanrum, a way to get past it which THEY SIGNED ON TO...... but now they and you are WHINING about it....jeez.. what jerks.

liar nothing. It most certainly. We're talking $44B I think out of the projected increase, or something similar. BTW, real cuts would have been fine with me. Hnadled correctly, no one would notice that either. Got of get rid of baseline budgeting.
Obama had no thought repubs would go along. They did. O doesn't like it.
you are a liar. congress is not "attempting" to exempt itself from obamacare...... just a stupid and old lie.... and it does not matter what lying gop liar you claim you got your lie from

Message.Title: seaburgc repeats the old lie that "congress staffers ""could be"" exempt from Obamacare
Message.Msg: it's a lie that "congress staffers ""could be"" exempt from Obamacare.. a lie repeated by the lying liar pubbies like seaburgc . Media falsely claim Obama and staff are "exempt" from health care reform Media have falsely claimed President Obama, members of his administration, and certain congressional staff are "exempt" from the recently enacted health care bill. In fact, the bill subjects the White House, members of Congress, and their staffs to the same reforms and requirements as the rest of the American people. White House, Congress, and federal employees are subject to same health care reforms applied to American people White House, Congress required to carry health insurance like everyone else. Starting in 2014, Americans will be required to have minimum health insurance coverage, with exemptions for certain people with religious objections or the inability to afford coverage. The bill does not exempt government employees such as leaders and staffers at the White House and Congress. Insurers covering government workers will be subject to insurance regulations. The insurers participating in the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program, through which federal workers obtain health coverage, are not exempt from the regulations imposed by the bill on insurers. These regulations include prohibitions on lifetime limits on coverage and denial of coverage to those with pre-existing conditions, and the requirement to spend 80-85 percent of premiums on medical claims, among others. Bill does not require Americans to enroll in health care exchange plans. Contrary to the suggestion that participating in the exchange plans is mandatory, there is no such requirement

Well, Waxman did say that people are confused. Yeah, confused over a 2700 page bill that no one read. That can't possibly be confusing, right Mesa, ya bum ya.

In just over five years, daily deal company LivingSocial went from D.C. technology start-up to one of the District's largest employers, with the backing of marquee investors. Then, last October, the company announced a massive $566 million third-quarter loss as revenue declined and it was forced to take heavy writedowns on prior acquisitions. The following month, the company laid off roughly 10% of its workforce. What went wrong?
Confusion -- repeating the same lies over and over again leads to confusion
Sequester was just another of Obama's bad ideas. IMPEACH PELOSI NOW!!!

APNewsBreak: Russia caught bomb suspect on wiretap Apr 27, 5:18 PM (ET) By EILEEN SULLIVAN and MATT APUZZO WASHINGTON (AP) - Russian authorities secretly recorded a telephone conversation in 2011 in which one of the Boston bombing suspects vaguely discussed jihad with his mother, officials said Saturday, days after the U.S. government finally received details about the call. In another conversation, the mother of now-dead bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev was recorded talking to someone in southern Russia who is under FBI investigation in an unrelated case, officials said. The conversations are significant because, had they been revealed earlier, they might have been enough evidence for the FBI to initiate a more thorough investigation of the Tsarnaev family.

Topic.Title: SYRIA Crosses Obama's "Red Line" and Obama Punts!

Message.Msg: The Presidential Wheel Turns Disaffection for Bush gave us Obama. That explains the new affection for Bush. By PEGGY NOONAN Like this columnist Barack Obama was elected president in 2008 because he was not George W. Bush. In fact, he was elected because he was the farthest thing possible from Mr. Bush. On some level he knew this, which is why every time he got in trouble he'd say Bush's name. It's all his fault, you have no idea the mess I inherited. As long as Mr. Bush's memory was hovering like Boo Radley in the shadows, Mr. Obama would be OK. This week something changed. George W. Bush is back, for the unveiling of his presidential library. His numbers are dramatically up. You know why? Because he's the farthest thing from Barack Obama. Obama fatigue has opened the way to Bush affection. *** In all his recent interviews Mr. Bush has been modest, humorous, proud but unassuming, and essentially philosophical: History will decide. No finger-pointing or scoring points. If he feels rancor or resentment he didn't show it. He didn't attempt to manipulate. His sheer normality seemed like a relief, an echo of an older age. And all this felt like an antidote to Obama—to the imperious I, to the inability to execute, to the endless interviews and the imperturbable drone, to the sense that he is trying to teach us, like an Ivy League instructor taken aback by the backwardness of his students. *** This is EXACTLY spot on. Let Biden take over. U.S. can't take 3 more years of this clown. IMPEACH PELOSI NOW!!!

Message.Title: is the worm turning?
Message.Msg: I dunno, but this is interesting. Mark Zuckerberg of Facebook fame touting virtues of big oil and dangers of Obamacare. Hmmm. FWD.us, the political action group founded by Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg and other Silicon Valley big shots, says its purpose is to promote comprehensive immigration reform. But some of their recent ads talk more about the dangers of Obamacare and the virtues of Big Oil. That doesn’t sound very much like the Zuckerberg of old, ThinkProgress says. In fact, Zuckerberg wrote in an op-ed in The Washington Post, that “The economy of the last century was primarily based on natural resources … Today’s economy is very different. It is based primarily on knowledge and ideas.”

Message.Title: Sen. Joe Manchin says gun bill to be reintroduced
Message.Msg: Manchin said that if only people would read the bill people would see it his way. Trouble is for Manchin, all the key elements were brought forth and hashed out first time around. And if was rejected. But he insists that if only they would read the bill.

Message.Title: Americans fear government more than terror
Message.Msg: According to a pair of recent polls, for the first time since the 9/11 terrorist hijackings, Americans are more fearful their government will abuse constitutional liberties than fail to keep its citizens safe. Even in the wake of the April 15 Boston Marathon bombing – in which a pair of Islamic radicals are accused of planting explosives that took the lives of 3 and wounded over 280 – the polls suggest Americans are hesitant to give up any further freedoms in exchange for increased “security.” One poll is Fox news. The other is the Washington POst. Is the worm turning? Hmmm.
